Why might some antivirus software flag this software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Some antivirus software, such as Avast and Kaspersky, might flag this software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" because it is mining software, which could potentially be installed by a third party to exploit the user's PC.
